alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Henrico; Greensville; Lunenburg; Prince George; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:40PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL GREENSVILLE... CENTRAL NOTTOWAY...NORTHWESTERN SUSSEX...DINWIDDIE...SOUTHERN CHESTERFIELD...EAST CENTRAL LUNENBURG...WESTERN PRINCE GEORGE...SOUTH CENTRAL HENRICO...SOUTHEASTERN AMELIA AND BRUNSWICK COUNTIES...THE CITY OF COLONIAL HEIGHTS...THE CITY OF HOPEWELL AND THE CITY OF PETERSBURG THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 140 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Carson to near McKenney. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, McKenney, and Dewitt around 145 PM EDT. Fort Gregg-Adams around 150 PM EDT. Colonial Heights, Virginia State University, Ettrick, and Matoaca around 155 PM EDT. Sutherland around 200 PM EDT. Hopewell and Chester around 205 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include North Wellville, Dolphin, Ammon, Murdocks, Pleasant Shade, Wharfs Store, Pocahontas State Park, Wellville, Beach, and Richard Bland College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Henrico; Greensville; Lunenburg; Prince George; Sussex
